sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The nightingale vvarbling forth her owne disaster; or The rape of Philomela. Newly written in English verse, by Martin Parker M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656? Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D. Metamorphoses. Book 6.
[44] p.
Printed by G[eorge] P[urslowe] for William Cooke, and are to be sold at his shop neere Furnevals Inne gate in Holbourne, London : 1632.
Based on the story in book 6 of the "Metamorphoses" of Ovid. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-C (-A1,C8). Running title reads: The rape of Philomel. Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[44] p.
Printed by G[eorge] P[urslowe] for William Cooke, and are to be sold at his shop neere Furnevals Inne gate in Holbourne, London : 1632.
Based on the story in book 6 of the "Metamorphoses" of Ovid. In verse. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: A-C (-A1,C8). Running title reads: The rape of Philomel. Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
